etymologies: Middle English: from Old French menestralsie, from menestrel (see minstrel)

definitions: the art or occupation of a medieval minstrel

examples.text: a tradition of oral minstrelsy stretching back for centuries

definitions: the form of entertainment associated with minstrel shows, featuring songs, dances, and formulaic comic routines based on stereotyped depictions of black Americans and typically performed by white actors with blackened faces

examples.text: it was a counter to the proliferation of racist caricatures, particularly in blackface minstrelsy

shortDefinitions: form of entertainment associated with minstrel shows
